result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua N Hadley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Maintain full-time employment as determined by Dept. of Corrections.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Joshua N Hadley
Current: 1210 Bonnie View Drive, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235 United States  (Effective: 04-22-2016)
Prior: 529 W Maple, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

Defendant Joshua N Hadley in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. Victim makes statement. State/Defense give joint sentencing recommendation. Defendant makes statement to the court. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua N Hadley in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 2.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 2. Court dismisses Ct. 1, 3 & 4 but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. Defense asks court to set off sentencing for 30 days. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Joshua N Hadley in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Malcore feels optimistic that matters may resolve, requests a status in March. State has no objection to adjournment. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Joshua N Hadley in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Malcore indicates matter is not resolved, would like to resolve 15-CF-97 before proceeding with this file. Atty Malcore asks that file continue to track 15-CF-97. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Atty Malcore requests a status date to allow her to review discovery and try to work out global resolution on both pending matters. Discussion regarding joint trial with co-defendant in file 15-CF-97. Court needs to hear from Atty Malcore by the end of January as to whether matter should be set for trial or not.   Bond remains as is.

Defendant Joshua N Hadley in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Joshua N Hadley in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, requests prelim/arraignment on 12/28/15 when defendant will be in court on another matter.  Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Per JA Sheryl Ripp, IA moved to 12/14/15 at 10:00 as Atty Sarah Malcore is not available 12/07/15.
No violent contact with M.H.   To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Joshua N Hadley appears by video conference along with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers who appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 12/07/15 at 10:00 am.
